stem: A 52-year-old typist reports nocturnal paresthesias in the lateral three and a half digits and difficulty buttoning shirts. Phalen testing reproduces symptoms. Which motor deficit most strongly confirms median nerve compression within the carpal tunnel?

choices.A: Weakness of thumb abduction with thenar flattening
choices.B: Loss of wrist extension against resistance
choices.D: Loss of sensation over the medial forearm

rationale_correct: Median nerve compression in the carpal tunnel compromises the recurrent branch to the abductor pollicis brevis, producing thenar flattening and weak thumb abduction.

rationale_distractors.B: Wrist extension relies on radial nerve innervation of the posterior compartment.
rationale_distractors.C: Thumb adduction is supplied by the ulnar nerve (adductor pollicis).
rationale_distractors.D: Medial forearm sensation travels via the medial antebrachial cutaneous nerve from the medial cord.
rationale_distractors.E: Finger abduction depends on ulnar-innervated interossei.
